main event: Two unidentified flying objects were observed in Omaha, Nebraska, on December 7, 1958. One light was observed to flash in flight from right to left and then disappear, while the other remained steady in flight.
interesting points: One object flashed in flight and descended to tree level before disappearing, while the other light remained steady at the same altitude and speed.
The flashing light appeared to be under intelligent control, and the observer noted that no contact was made on radar.
The rotating lights on the UFO were described as passing from right to left along the edge of a plane roughly parallel to the ground, with the red light preceding the green light.
The observed UFO remained suspended in space and was obscured by a light cloud bank that moved in from the southwest, disappearing after being in sight for two hours and fifteen minutes.
The observation was made by two civilian observers and a military observer, who identified the object as bluish-white and compared it to a quarter held at arm's length.
sighted object: two unidentified flying objects with one light flashing and the other remaining steady
witnesses: two civilian observers and one military observer
photographs: no photographs or physical evidence obtained
